Pages 25-28
- Living/Placement
Home/Independent Living, [PHI] and [PHI]
- Programs/Follow-Up
Partial Hospitalization Program and Individual Therapy/Medication Management
- Discharge Goals and Criteria
"Establish and maintain safety (no SI/HI, self harm, aggression)", "Improvement in signs and symptoms of mood disorder and/or psychosis" and Build insight into condition
No long-term care plan mentioned. Pages 1-28.

Diagnoses:
- Major depressive disorder, recurrent, unspecified (F33.9) Page 1
- Acute embolism and thrombosis of unspecified deep veins of right lower extremity (I82.401) Page 1

- Other pulmonary embolism without acute cor pulmonale (I26.99) Page 1
- Unspecified convulsions (R56.9) Page 1

PMHx
- Left hip replacement (5 years ago) Page 8
- Back surgery (5 years ago) Page 8 
- Seizures from alcohol withdrawal (unknown time ago) Page 8
- Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism (PE) (2 years ago) Page 8
- Gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) (2 years ago) Page 8
- Other pulmonary embolism (unknown time ago) Page 8
- Unspecified convulsions (unknown time ago) Page 8
Smoking: Yes, 1 cigarette per day. Page 11.

Drug Abuse: Yes
- Cocaine/Crack: Snort/Inhale, $40 / daily, 20's, 6/30/2023 (Page 3)
- Opiates (heroin/Oxy): Injects, $80 / heroin, 18, 6/30/2023 (Page 3)

ETOH Abuse: Yes
- Alcohol, 1/2 gallon of alcohol / daily, teen, 6/30/2023, Current (Page 11)
- Individual Therapy, Group Therapy and Expressive Therapy (Page 19)

Concerns:
- SI with plan to [PHI] on prescription meds (Page 1)
- C-SSRS Score from Intake 18. Note: A score of 15 or more indicates "high risk". (Page 2)
- plan to [PHI] (Page 2)
- Unable to contract for safety and requires Immediate hospitalization for safety and stabilization. (Page 3)
- Risk of harm to SELF - Inability to care for self, Thoughts to harm self, Active suicidal Ideation/intention, Active suicide plan and Unable to contract for safety (Page 4)
- Level of Observation: Q10 minutes (Q10) Reason: SI with plan to [PHI] on prescription meds (Page 5)
- Precautions SUICIDAL Precaution, HIGH RISK Precaution and DETOX (Page 5)

Commercial insurance (for example Blue Cross Blue Shield (BCBS), United Health Care (UHC), Aetna, Cigna, Humana, Health Care Services Corporation (HCSC), Centene, Kaiser Permanente, Molina Healthcare, Health Alliance, Anthem)
